answers.answer: Thyroiditis usually has decreased vascularity w/ exception of early stages of hashimoto's thyroiditis -- check thyroid antibodies -- any thyroiditis will cause the inhomogeneous echotexture and the reactive appearing lymph nodes.  The nodules are small, but depending on their appearance may need FNA.  The TSH is normal and there is no urgency based on what you describe (besides wanting more answers) - so waiting 3 months is annoying but probably reasonable.

Thanks for the peace of mind.  My PCP said that I had Hashimoto's in 97, but said the antibody screen was negative.  The only thing abnormal with my labs recently was my fasting sugar level was a little elevated.  With a family history of diabetes, I am watching my weight and what I eat.  Would Hashimotos cause issues with blood sugar?  Is it possible to have Hashimotos and not have antibodies?  Would increasing my meds or trying a different med help reduce the gland/nodule size?  After 10 yrs of being on the same thyroid med, does it ever become ineffective?I had a DVT in my leg and was dx with hereditary factor V defic. last year and had to take coumadin for 6 months.  I am now on a daily dose of aspirin. It seems the issue with my thyroid started after going off the birth control and taking the blood thinners.  Any thoughts on if it all might be related?

question: 32 yrs old, dx w/hypothyroidism  1997. See pcp for annual labs, taking 75mcg synthroid. Most recent labs TSH 1.62  11/2006  and  TSH 1.53  Free T4 1.10 11/2005.  Sonogram 3/97 showed mod enlargement, right lobe 5.4cm with trans 2.3cm and left lobe 4.6cm w/ trans 2.4cm generalized inhomogeneous exho-texture compatible with goiter, uptake 3hr=9.5% and 24 hr 25.7%. The past year thyroid appears to be larger and experiencing symptoms-sluggishness, pressure when swallowing, headaches, swollen glands in neck, chronic sore throat and occassional hoarseness.ENT requested US. Results: Thyroid enlarged bilat and demos hetero echotexture, multiple hypoechoic foci.  Isthmus shows hetero echotexture.  Right lobe- 2.4 cm APx 3cm trans x 5.3cm long, no dominant mass lesions noted Left lobe- 2.6cm AP x 2.3cm trans x 5.9cm long, hetero parenchyma noted, 2 hypoechoic thyroid nodules- one superior portion 0.7cm AP x 0.9cm trans x 1cm long and one medial nodule 0.9cm AP x 1cm trans x 0.9cm long. Multiple cervical lymph nodes normal in appearance-0.9cm AP x 1.6cm trans x 1.8cm long.  color doppler shows increased parenchymal blood flow to thyroid.  Impression: diffusely enlarged and hetero parenchyma thyroid gland w/increased vascularity suggestive of thyroiditis. ENT suggested Endo spec, first avail. appt in 3 months.  The ENT is sending results and requesting an earlier appt.  Please give me your impression of the results and what you think I can expect as follow-up treatment.  Should I be concerned by the delay in seeing the Endo?  I am a little worried at this point and don't have a clue about what these results really mean other than my thyroid is larger than it was in 1997.  I would greatly appreciate any explanation and suggestions you might have.
title: what do results mean and what next
